means: 故意对…作错误的报道( misrepresent的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He said that the press had misrepresented him as arrogant and bullying.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说新闻媒体把他歪曲成了一个傲慢而又霸道的人。

sentence.Network_en: He felt that the book misrepresented his opinions.
sentence.Network_cn: 他觉得这本书歪曲了他的观点。

sentence.Network_en: Ecstasy is widely misrepresented as a soft drug.
sentence.Network_cn: 迷幻药被普遍误传为软性毒品.

entry.tran: 误述;对…作不准确的叙述;歪曲
entry.def: If someone misrepresents a person or situation, they give a wrong or inaccurate account of what the person or situation is like.

example.ex: He said that the press had misrepresented him as arrogant and bullying...
example.tran: 他说新闻媒体把他歪曲成了一个傲慢而又霸道的人。

example.ex: Hollywood films misrepresented us as drunks, maniacs and murderers...
example.tran: 好莱坞电影把我们歪曲成酒鬼、疯子和杀人凶手。

means.word_mean: 1. having an intended meaning altered or misrepresented;

sentences.sentence: "many of the facts seemed twisted out of any semblance to reality"

auth_sentence.content: They have misrepresented their members' views to management.

auth_sentence.content: These warlords have misrepresented the Pashtuns to Western policymakers.
